intro: Wormskioldia pilosa, commonly known as the woolly wormskioldia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are covered in fine, hairy structures that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Wormskioldia pilosa is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
